name: myopia
content:
myopia noun [U]
(SIGHT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a condition in which someone cannot clearly see things that are far away: He suffers from severe myopia and nerve damage in his right eye. Those with myopia can often read without glasses or lenses. Synonym
short-sightednessOpposite
hyperopia
More examplesFewer examplesResearch has suggested that children who play sport are less susceptible to myopia.Myopia is caused when the eyeball grows too long, causing light to focus in front of the retina.No evidence was found that visual training has any effect on the progression of myopia.

myopia noun [U]
(NOT THINKING)
the fact of not thinking enough about how an action will affect the future, or an example of this: People's myopia often blinded them from seeing the bigger picture. It is another example of disturbing myopia. Synonym
short-sightedness (THOUGHT)
More examplesFewer examplesHe has certainly been accused of myopia himself at times.The first part of the century offers a vivid illustration of that myopia.How is it that moral myopia or moral muteness about ethical issues of confidentiality in mediation might be addressed?
